problem_text: Suppose that a subgroup H of a finite group G is such that HM = MH for every minimal non-nilpotent subgroup M of G. Must H/HG be nilpotent, where HG is the largest normal subgroup of G contained in H? V. N. Knyagina, V. S. Monakhov
answer: No, not always (A. Ballester-Bolinches, R. Esteban-Romero, S. F. Kamornikov, V. P´erez-Calabuig, J. Algebra, 608 (2022), 382–387).
